website_summaries.verdict: Sharp-looking 16-speed bike that performs well on the road in varying conditions.
pros: Works well as an introductory or intermediate road bike
cons: Higher price than some other options
Can be uncomfortable on rough roads

customer_reviews.title: Female Road Bike 🚴‍♀️.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful bike ! Delivery on time ! Thank You Very Much ! My daughter is very happy with this bike! Thanks, Well done ! Good Job 😂🚴🏾‍♂️👍🏾
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: satisfied customer here
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'5" 225 lbs and it is perfect. I raised the seat up for a proper fit. Easy to assemble. I changed my pedals to the Shimano to accommodate the cleats. Bike is light and sturdy. The brakes are REALLY squeaky, even after 10-15 rides but the work.
customer_reviews.author: nalexian

customer_reviews.title: This is my first road bike
customer_reviews.text: After riding this bike for over a year, I definitely need to upgreade. It was a great FIRST bike, but now that I am a much better rider, I need something lightweight, 26lbs is way too heavy. Plus, this is marketed as having 2 bottle holders but mine only came with one (15" model) I guess the frame is too small to accommodate two of them.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal N.

customer_reviews.title: the bike frame and components are overall of good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife. While clearly not a Cannondale, the bike frame and components are overall of good quality for the price. The seat that comes with the bike is unbearable, however, and we replaced it immediately. The brakes are also of very poor quality, and probably won't last long. I bored out the mount holes in the frame, and replaced them with better quality road bike caliper brakes from the local bike shop.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wood

customer_reviews.title: beautiful bike
customer_reviews.text: A great first time road bike. Didn't take long to assemble, but for safety precautions I took it to the bike shop to make it road ready. For reference, I am 5"2". This bike is the right size. So light and beautiful, I love it. Update: I've had this bike for more than 4 years now. It's was a great investment
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this bike because I loved the colors and read the reviews
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this bike because I loved the colors and read the reviews, my friend set up the bike and said the bike will need adjustments but not major ones, I have not done those adjustments and just been riding it seems to be fine, the seat is very uncomfortable had to purchase a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike for price!
customer_reviews.text: Bicycle is very light and very thin. Front tire tends to loose air after a few days. I got a new inner tube from Kent but it does the same thing. Rear tire holds air well so not sure why front doesn't. Other then that the Giordano Libero 1.6 has been Awesome and I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Was a Christmas gift for someone else but she loved it
customer_reviews.author: shard92

customer_reviews.title: Hello. The bike has 2 parts missing. The ...
customer_reviews.text: Hello. The bike has 2 parts missing.The 2 washers on the front wheel that sustain it weren't in the package so then the front wheel falls off.The left pedal has a scratch
customer_reviews.author: ernesto

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike,great price!
customer_reviews.text: This bike is fabulous..my little girl is 9 and she really needs another 6 months to get into this bike but she can ride short distances for now..it will last her a long time. Giordano has a good line of bicycles and youth bikes are hard to find.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Wadkins

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: nice ride but parts aren't as good as i thought they would be; breaks rub
customer_reviews.author: CHERIE

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and loved
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift for an employee for a job well done. Christa loves the bike and could barely wait until all assembly was complete before she hopped on it and took off. Sleek, fast and so light weight. Fit her like a glove.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Russell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bike. Good purchase experience. Very happy. Arrived in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda Schmalz

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Great value! My wife was super excited to finally get Nice first! road bike setup. Overall great starter frame, good components, and a Nice look
customer_reviews.author: James M

customer_reviews.title: BEAUTIFUL Bicycle...but style is not for me!
customer_reviews.text: I certainly cannot fully rate the Giordano Libero 1.6 ladies bicycle. I have ridden it exactly 10 miles and found it not to be the "style" of bicycle for me. I believe it to be perfect for a younger person (except for the seat). That I would have to rate low. It is extremely uncomfortable and would have to be changed immediate. It was easy to set up because I set it up myself. Again, I believe it to be a beautiful bicycle for someone else. It just does not work for me
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good Tri Starter Bike
customer_reviews.text: Bought the bike for my wife and she uses it constantly. She has used it in 3 TRIs and it has not failed her. Thes on the bike do wear out quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Shultz

customer_reviews.title: Great bike.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my wife, as her first road bike. So far, so good. We have upgraded a couple of things, but overall, we have been really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Robb

customer_reviews.title: Very nice looking bike but on long trips they should had ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking bike but on long trips they should had made it with more of a shock system to absorb some of the pavement bumps.. rough ride..
customer_reviews.author: lorajohnson

customer_reviews.title: Bike
customer_reviews.text: Bike is an entry level bike. Handle bars are loose even with proper assembly. It's nice and light and is stylish. Seat is very comfortable gears need tuning after 100 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Goo bike

customer_reviews.title: I love this bike!
customer_reviews.text: This bike was recommended and given two thumbs up by my teen boys who are cyclists. It's very easy to ride and provides all the necessary items for a bike. I'm 4'10" and purchased the small size. It was easy to assemble and enjoy riding. I recommend this bike for anyone who needs a first time bike.
customer_reviews.author: MMC

customer_reviews.title: Not delivered as promised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike for my daughters birthday. Prime didn't deliver as promised. They delayed by 3 days. Bike was packaged decently, and it seems to be of good quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Tahmassi

customer_reviews.title: Love this bike
customer_reviews.text: bike is very lite and well constructed. My wife is five two and she is very happy with the 15 inch frame. Shifters work very well and were easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Janet D. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Actually nice quality components!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptic but was surprised at what a nice bike this really is. Came packed well and only took a couple minutes to have it peddling. My girlfriend who is 5'2" fits perfect and took it on a ten mile ride her first time. She hadn't ridden for years and said it was easy to ride and just loves it. So, it's not a top of the line bike but if you are wanting an entry level bike this is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: LANJAMM

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for 10 year old daughter
customer_reviews.text: First real bike for daughter and she loves it. She has participated in a few kids triathlons and has been at disadvantage from riding kids bike. This bike has all elements of a high-end road bike. It has quick release wheels, break shifters and quality derailers. Good size for smaller riders and very adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Returned it.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 4'10" and this bike is not for short framed women. They just lowered the top tube so you could stand over it. It's to long and the 700c tires are wrong for short framed women. So now I'm going to a LBS to get fitted correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Mona Ghirin

customer_reviews.title: Came with zero assembly instructions
customer_reviews.text: Not an idiot but have never assembled a bike before - some rudimentary instructions on exactly what to do, especially fitting the front wheel, would have been helpful
customer_reviews.author: Paul M. Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Great bike.
customer_reviews.text: My husband...boyfriend at that time...got me this bike for my birthday...it was great surprise... I’m 5’5 and it’s feels that frame is too small for me. He got me medium. Not sure. Maybe I need to get used to it. But bike is great.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded my expectations, both in timeliness and in the product itself. Totally beautiful bike and it handles very well. I highly recommend this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: New to Riding
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice bike, however, it is a beginners bike only. One of my main complaints is that it has the old standard tire valves whereas todays cycling bikes have the thinner valve stems. I wasn't able to buy a replacement tube b/c the valve stems were different which meant that the hole in the rim was bigger so you can't just swap them out that easily. Not sure of why it's that way.
customer_reviews.author: AirborneHero

product_meta.title: Giordano Libero 1.6 White/Pink Womens Road Bike-700c
product_meta.description: The bike that started it all is back and better than ever. The beautifully made, hand crafted, lightweight 6061 aluminum frame continues to be the Foundation for this well thought out road bike. The women's libero features Shimano Claris 16 speed STI Shifters and Derailleurs matched to an aluminum road 50-34 compact crank to help make climbing less grueling. Light weight and strong aluminum 700c wheels round out this impressive package. With a very reasonable weight of 26lbs (weighed including the kickstand and reflectors) the libero is perfect for the weekend road WARRIOR or enthusiast mountain biker looking for some roadie fitness. Available in women's small, and medium.
feature_bullets: 16-speed Shimano Claris STI Shifters and Rear Derailleur
